001package org.relationlearn.model;
002
003import org.relationlearn.exception.AlreadyExistingNodeException;
004
005/**
006 * The RelationDigraph interface represents a directed weighted graph used to
007 * store all arguments in the form of ArgumentNode objects and the relations
008 * between those nodes in the form of ArgumentRelation objects.
009 * 
010 * @see ArgumentNode
011 * @see ArgumentRelation
012 */
013public interface RelationDigraph extends Iterable<ArgumentNode> {
014
015    /**
016     * Returns the ArgumentNode with id equal to {@code nodeId}, this
017     * method is expected to return null if there's no such ArgumentNode.
018     * 
019     * @param nodeId the id of the ArgumentNode to return.
020     * 
021     * @return the ArgumentNode with id {@code nodeId} or null if 
022     * the node can't be found.
023     */
024    public ArgumentNode getArgumentNode(int nodeId);
025    
026    /**
027     * Adds a new ArgumentNode to this RelationDigraph.
028     * 
029     * <p>
030     * <b>Note:</b> Conditions for this method exception throw are
031     * implementation dependent and should be specified in 
032     * their corresponding javadoc page.
033     * </p>
034     * 
035     * @param node the ArgumentNode to add
036     * 
037     * @throws AlreadyExistingNodeException
038     */
039    public void addArgumentNode(ArgumentNode node) 
040            throws AlreadyExistingNodeException;
041    
042    /**
043     * Checks if this RelationDigraph has a node stored with the
044     * id equal to {@code nodeId}.
045     * 
046     * @param nodeId the id of the ArgumentNode to look for existence in the
047     * RelationDigraph object.
048     * 
049     * @return true if there's a node with id equal to {@code nodeId}, 
050     * false otherwise.
051     */
052    public boolean containsNode(int nodeId);
053}
